Meanwhile, we are trying to provide SW solutions to meet the needs by identifying them through the OOO industry, Capstone project, and surveys of target consumers in the OOO SW competition. As in the field, we are discussing the optimal SW design architecture before development, complying with Agile Process and Clean Code during development, and developing a web full stack with Node js, React JS," and "Challengeing the meta feature extraction research, which lacks the number of existing research papers because it is a new AI technology in the secure layer, we analyzed in-depth the process of using existing MFE such as more than 15 English papers on MFE and AutoML, OpenML, Cykitron's AutoML library, and Feature selection algorithm recommendation papers. As a result, utilizing existing databases such as OpenML and repository storing solutions for them, Cykitrun's AutoML performs meta-learning on the input dataset, extracts learning algorithms and parameters used in the most similar dataset group, preprocesses and classification learning and Bayesian optimization, and optimizes them with ensemble techniques to derive the optimal AI solution for the input dataset, and FS Algorithm has concluded that it recommends the optimal FS model using meta learning. In the future, we will present a paper by implementing our own AutoML library based on MFE and OpenML. Based on my successful experience with pure passion, effort, and collaboration by challenging the difficult AI new technology research, I will also challenge the new technology at KT DS and produce high-quality SW services.""I am the first to provide SW solutions that meet the new inconveniences and needs of consumers in the unprepared new era of untact, and I am also confident that KT DS will be the first to identify the business needs of clients and customers and meet them with the optimal SW solution." Specifically, we have planned and are currently working on the first educational support web app that complements the limitations of 'e-learning center' and 'clasting' in the OOO SW competition finals through a survey of elementary school teachers. Using Node and React, users will sign up and log in to participate in real-time chat rooms, make announcements, open small chat rooms, use of whispering function, and add video chat function afterward. In addition, I have experience leading the Capstone Project for six months at EPITH Paris. Based on my initial business plan of identifying users' mental state based on their heart rate and providing appropriate music accordingly, I gradually embodied the functions and design of the app with my team members. In addition, the team shared the vision that it would reduce users' daily stress, and faithfully performed each other's parts for six months. I was in charge of Arduino coding, UI development, heart rate analysis algorithm search and development, and completed an initial application called MusicMe, and was selected as A grade in recognition of the novelty of ideas and sincere process performance.",,,,

The "Professional Communicator who also communicates with user logs" IT job is to develop information systems such as BGF Retail's POS system so that merchants can efficiently perform sales operations. Without a computerized information system such as inventory management, ordering, and calculation at convenience stores, all tasks will be disrupted. IT personnel should always strive to improve user convenience beyond simply preventing errors from appearing in the system. To do this, it is necessary to be able to constantly communicate with users, understand their work, identify needs, and come up with improvement plans. To realize this, the attitude of communication that has been experienced while operating the system will be a great strength in performing tasks. There were time and physical limitations to always communicate directly with users while operating the system, so I developed a habit of checking the logs. While checking the logs, I found that the user repeated the same tasks at the same time. Accordingly, we conducted an interview and agreed on the user's inconvenience and suggested an RPA service that could solve it. By automating the work, we were able to improve customer discomfort and generate company profits. If we listen to not only direct communication but also indirect communication, we will contribute to the organization by discovering the needs of system users and resolving inconveniences. In the IT field, new technologies such as IoT, big data, and AI are constantly pouring out more than other fields. Just as CU opened a hybrid convenience store, we will constantly acquire and apply new technologies to create a store where people and technologies come together to put the convenience of customers and franchisees first by combining new technologies," and "If we fail to communicate, we will go to the mountains." I think the most important competency in achieving the common goal is communication skills. This is because a group cannot communicate well, just as there are many workers going to the mountains, just as a group goes to the mountains. As a grade representative, I believe communication is the center of collaboration, and I have experience in drawing consensus from student council groups. While planning the festival, even though we had a common goal of an unforgettable festival, we had difficulties due to differences in opinions of each department. The general affairs department failed to reach a consensus by raising profitability, the planning department by raising student interest, and the chairman and vice chairman by raising external aspects, and asked each department to present guidelines after sufficient meetings to resolve these issues. As a result of continuing to mediate opinions to hold events that are satisfactory to all, we were able to reach a consensus that students could be satisfied with within the budget. I think the reason why we have different opinions even within the same organization is that each person has different responsibilities. I will become an IT expert who develops, operates, and maintains the best services in BGF Retail by drawing consideration and communication from people from various positions. "Winning the prize through unique presentation method through role play" and "RFID Technology" were given a silver award for differentiated presentation method that introduced role play in technical report preparation and presentation competitions. In preparing for the presentation, I thought it would be difficult to understand after hearing only the presentation about the first technology I encountered, so I thought a lot about the presentation method using role play. After much thought, I suggested the presentation method using role play to my team members as a part of the parts needed for technology. However, the team members refused due to the fear of the presentation and the fact that it would take a long time to prepare. Therefore, I persuaded them by presenting the presentation in front of the team members once as a role play and once as a conventional presentation method, and I was able to get their consent. As a result, I was able to effectively understand the technology called RFID through my own differentiated presentation method. In addition, I was selected as a class representative and received a silver award by participating in a presentation competition hosted by the College of Engineering. Through these experiences, I was able to experience the importance of trying a creative approach and having a discriminatory competitiveness that is different from others. In addition, no matter what I do afterwards, I am trying to get better results by finding new ways without having any stereotypes." "Using mobile apps is an advantage, too many apps are a disadvantage," the CU convenience store app provides a reservation service. Recently, various convenience store foods have been introduced through the Pyeonstorang program, and products released through the Pyeonstorang program have the advantage of being easy to purchase through the app's reservation service. From the customer's point of view, the fact that they can purchase hot-talked-about products like the Honey Butter Chip fiasco has come as a big attraction in that they can buy them through the app without going in vain. On the other hand, I think it's a pity that there are too many CU-related apps such as Pocket CU, CU Convenience Store Delivery, and CU By-Self. This is because they would think that if they had to download three convenience store-related apps and use them even though they are not apps that they always use like messenger or SNS, they would unnecessarily use too much data and capacity. "Focus on product R&D by reducing the cost of low value-added work" Convenience stores usually use places that are close to them when they need something. However, in order to purchase hot-talked-about products such as Pyeonstorang products, they look for places that sell them, even if they are far away. I think developing and releasing a lot of hot-talked-about products like this is a way to increase the competitiveness of CU convenience stores. In order to reduce the cost of low value-added work and focus on high value-added work such as product R&D, it would be better to consider automating work through RPA instead of low value-added work. In addition, product research and development requires a lot of money to be invested. To cover these costs, IT jobs will need to consider introducing a cloud environment to reduce the cost of servers.",,,,

"Activity and the spirit of challenge nurtured in other countries." When I was in the second grade of elementary school, I entered a local school in the U.S. without any English proficiency. There were only Asians in the school, and no one came forward to help. Everything, such as on-campus competitions and events, was a challenge, and I adapted by actively talking to my teachers and friends in poor English. This year's activeness that I have gained from other countries has allowed me not to be afraid of new challenges. People around me say that I am versatile, because I challenged myself even if I was not in a good field rather than because I was excellent at it. When there was no one who could do Photoshop or video editing, I took charge of it and learned video lectures, and based on my R skills, I learned various programs such as Python and VBA whenever I needed. Even though I was not a related major, I was the vice chairman of the Financial Engineering Association and actively showed interest in finance enough to achieve curriculum reform. This activeness can sometimes be a disadvantage. As there are many things I want to try, I sometimes cannot finish what I started because I am greedy for a limited amount of time. I took the time to go to China for a month to learn Chinese, but I almost couldn't take the English certification exam that I had planned. Taking this opportunity, I am practicing how to prioritize work and manage time leisurely and systematically so that I can carry out important work step by step. "Leader who embraces everyone" My experience in the U.S. became an asset, but I couldn't forget the feeling of being left alone at that time. I felt the big difference that a single helping hand made, so I developed a sense of value to be the one who gave that hand. I felt the duty to create an atmosphere in which everyone can participate without any alienated members, so I self-proclaimed myself as a mood maker and made efforts for unity. People around me recognized this and I was selected as a vice chairman by performing clubs and financial engineering societies, so I was able to create an inclusive atmosphere. ��� 2-1 Please explain what you think are the core competencies required to perform the job you applied for and why. "Transmission and agility for business" I want to become an asset management expert at Shinhan Bank. I think the key to this is the ability to transmit and quickness accompanied by expertise. When recommending a product or portfolio to a customer, you must be able to effectively convey the reason along with the evidence. This is because the customer must be able to intuitively understand it so that they can trust the asset management. Among the reviews on Robo-Advisor, I saw many opinions that the resulting algorithm was not reliable due to the lack of explanation. As such, it will become more important to easily explain and analyze customers' tendencies, markets, and past cases with manpower that cannot be digitally replaced. You also need the agility to respond to various requirements because you face a wide variety of customers. When faced with an unexpected situation, you should persuade your customers calmly rather than panicking. Work agility in acquiring and applying new knowledge and methods immediately is also important in accordance with the rapidly changing financial market. ��� 2-2. Please describe in detail what kind of effort you have made to acquire that capability. "To become an omnipotent executive," I tried to acquire all kinds of capabilities, including expertise, delivery, and agility. Based on what I learned in the financial risk class, I worked as the vice chairman of the Financial Engineering Association and learned financial theory. Through lecture-style sessions, I taught the concepts to the academic members, and since many other students are new to finance, I have developed the ability to communicate easily by comparing credit derivatives to insurance. I studied and deepened my knowledge to obtain a certificate of asset management, and as an intern in the risk management department, I monitored risks related to the company's assets and applied what I learned to practice to develop the qualifications of financial experts. As I have also developed analytical capabilities with statistical projects, I can understand the process and results of data-based corporate credit ratings or asset management, and analyze customer tendencies based on past data to implement more effective asset management. In addition, I have worked part-time jobs for many years to satisfy the needs of customers of various nationalities, and I have also developed quickness and customer-oriented spirit. ��� 2-3 Please describe in detail what kind of dream you want to pursue in the field you applied for and why you want to achieve that dream at Shinhan Bank. "From increasing the efficiency of WM to popularization" "I want to become an expert in the most efficient asset management by analyzing the characteristics of customers through more detailed clustering by demonstrating financial knowledge and statistical capabilities. I felt the importance of grouping through customer data analysis experience, and I will lead the WM market by establishing a more sophisticated system, going beyond the existing WM method, which is subdivided into three stages of Shinhan Bank. For asset management, I will realize Shinhan's 'knowing customers right away' spirit, which values accurately identifying needs by analyzing customers from various fields first. Another reason why Shinhan wants to achieve its dream is that it can utilize the integrated data of all affiliates in various ways with the 'One Shinhan' strategy. After developing expertise, we will study to supplement it by presenting variables that reflect reality more precisely in the robo-advisor algorithm. I want to contribute to the popularization of asset management services by developing AI as a means of assisting manpower, increasing its usability and accessibility.","" Securing older customers of FinTech" The financial industry is constantly changing with the development of FinTech. Just as Shinhan Bank introduced the data-based corporate evaluation process using the CSS model, it can be approached not only in terms of work, but also in a more convenient service for customers. However, this change did not reach the older people, as the mobile banking utilization rate over 60s was only 5.5%. The spread of digital banking among the elderly is an opportunity to not only achieve the social purpose of resolving financial alienation, but also to accumulate data in banks and establish a platform to deposit customers in various fields such as the retirement market.Shinhan Bank has also been operating a separate window for senior citizens since 2016, and has been targeting senior citizens through SOL Senior, etc., but since there are fundamental barriers to entry such as distrust of machines, a more multidimensional and active target is needed. We conducted an analysis on the use of apps based on panel data, and fintech apps used the most among households of 4-5 years old or older. They interpreted that there is a higher probability of using them with the help of children or grandchildren than with voluntary use. One way is to provide family-level benefits so that families can encourage them to use them. We also need to devise various creative solutions, such as providing benefits that are more realistic as a refund rather than a discount, taking advantage of the characteristics of the elderly who are sensitive to even a small amount of money. "Achieving 250,000 views through collaboration." Last semester, I made a dance video to promote the club with four members as the vice chairman of a performance club. However, the process was not smooth. The roles were divided by drawing lots of people who wanted to take charge of overlapping parts, but the team members who could not take the desired part showed their motivation as they did not attend the practice. I held an idea meeting to re-engage my team members' voluntary participation. It was to remind them of a common goal while setting up specific strategies for topicality. We shared various ideas at the meeting. One friend suggested recruiting a separate filming team from the school community, and the other suggested filming on the rival university campus considering that the university competition was a hot topic at the time. I analyzed famous dance video channels, and I saw the comment window activated when the same person appeared steadily, and based on this, I came up with the idea of taking several videos and uploading them consecutively. As I shared my opinions, I felt close to my goal. In addition, there was an atmosphere in which we recognized the credit of each other's opinions, so we were able to redistribute our dance by yielding our part. The team members regained their motivation and invited a filming team to film the video. After that, as a result of posting promotions on the community and dance-related sites through division, the video reached 250,000 views in one month. It was an achievement through teamwork,,,,

I feel proud of the process of seeing the meaning of the analysis results based on ideas, not simply processing and inserting data into a set analysis frame. It is not an exaggeration to say that the whole nation uses telecommunication services, and it will continue to expand in the future. I would like to feel the joy of collaborating with colleagues who are experts in different fields to produce meaningful results using the vast amount of customer data that LG U+ has accumulated over the years. In order to develop my expertise as a data analyst, I conducted projects myself by learning various ways to access data and interpret the results by looking at examples of analysis in my major class. One of them was a project that I carried out last semester when I participated in a panel big data analysis competition held by our school. The analysis was conducted under the theme of consumption patterns of grooming people (men interested in beauty) using app usage and card payment data of 115,854 respondents. In order to create a variable that quantifies the degree of interest in beauty, we have devised a new method that weights the item as the reciprocal of the usage rate among the total respondents of each cosmetic item, so that the more rarely used cosmetics are of greater importance. Through the R tree model, logistic regression, and correlation analysis, I was able to get cosmetics marketing insights for male targets, and I received the Excellence Award. In addition, I gained experience by making OOO prediction models and receiving feedback from professors. I learned coding with interest and enthusiasm as I worked in my major class learning R and SAS. In statistical analysis, I learned other programs based on my R skills and applied coding when I was engaged in other activities as well. When I was working as the vice chairman of a financial association, I added sessions such as finding bond prices in Python and replaying simulations to teach other students. When I was an intern at an insurance company, I saw that I used Excel for most of my work, and I learned VBA by myself to automate repetitive work, thereby improving my coding skills steadily." In the second year of elementary school, I moved to the U.S. without being able to speak English at all and entered a local school. It was a difficult situation to face discrimination, but I was able to learn English in a short period of time by talking to my friends who were marginalized by short English. The childhood experience of making English my strength by taking advantage of the urgency of a situation that could have left me as a trauma gave me the confidence to challenge myself. I often hear from my friends that I am versatile. However, in fact, I think it's not because I'm good at it, but rather because I have a tendency to challenge myself with the mind of 'Shouldn't I be persistent?' Even though I had never learned Photoshop when I was working at a financial engineering association, I was in charge of producing promotional posters and watched YouTube lectures and made posters through Photoshop overnight. "I booked a plane right away because I wanted to learn Chinese and studied there for a month. Like this, I will not be afraid of challenges for innovation and ability improvement at work," said Lee, "I analyzed the propensity and consumption patterns of OOO (male interested in OOO) by using panel data of 115,854 respondents, the 2019 OO Big Data Analysis Competition, Excellence Award, Excellence Award. We measured the degree of interest in OO with a different approach and categorized the respondents accordingly, and conducted logistic regression, tree model, and correlation analysis to discover the patterns of consumption of the respondents, and organized them to gain marketing insights. [Intern], OOO Life Insurance's OOO management department, 20180917-20190228, daily stock and bond market conditions, calculated various risks related to the company's asset management, and prepared a report that integrates them. We performed the LAT simulation process with Excel VBA coding and automated existing iterative tasks to increase work efficiency.",,,,

"I will create synergy between knowledge and passion." I majored in industrial management engineering, but I am a late programmer who finally found my aptitude for IT after finishing the semester. For me, I think that LG CNS' smart factory/smart logistics job is a golden opportunity to demonstrate the knowledge I learned in the department and my passion for IT. I majored in industrial management engineering to learn how to manage various variables generated in the process through classes such as production control and management science, and I have experience working on the 'analysis and proposal of the current process' project through internships in the manufacturing industry. LG CNS is an attractive company to me in that it verifies applicants through internships with SW Boot Camp during the recruitment process. It is because I can experience the job in advance, and I can also develop in the process. I want to join LG CNS proudly by proving the synergy of my knowledge of process and logistics and passion for IT. I have two competencies to perform the smart factory/smart logistics job. The first is the IT knowledge necessary to design and manage the smart factory. I have been trying to understand the system logic based on SW algorithm by learning the programming language. After obtaining the information processor certificate and completing the six-month SW developer training course, I was able to learn programming languages such as Java and Oracle DB, and learn the latest IT trends such as new technologies and new security threats. Also, this year, I am working as a full-time researcher at the school to improve my data analysis ability. We are assisting in the 'Defect Analysis according to Elevator Vibration Pattern' project, and are acquiring Python, an analysis tool, and preparing for the sqld certification. Second, it is the ability to handle variables from the perspective of the supply chain, such as the perspective of facilities and the perspective of raw materials. I learned how to establish strategies for SCM and facility preservation through 'Management Science 1' and 'Management Engineering' subjects, and learned how to derive the optimal solution of productivity using 'Search for Solutions'. Based on this major knowledge, I worked as an intern at a manufacturing company in the second semester of 2016 and conducted the 'Analysis and Improvement Proposal of the Current Process' project. We analyzed the inventory management process by writing the relationship before and after the production process in the SCM flow chart, and calculated the defect rate through verification of the worker's work inefficiency. As a result of constant analysis and feedback, we were able to establish the data, and in the end, we announced that an additional cost of 27% was incurred due to the occurrence of duplicate and work inefficiency of the storage flow. I think the smart factory/smart logistics job needs parallel knowledge because improvement should be made in the IT system based on the understanding of the process. Through my passion for programming and knowledge and experience in process scheduling, I will become an essential employee in the manufacturing job."" Specialist of MES solution development LG CNS provides various types of solutions depending on the IT area and the industry of suppliers. Among them, I want to become an employee who develops MES solutions that can coexist together by maximizing QCDs of manufacturing partners. To this end, I will work hard to understand the MES solutions of LG CNS such as iPhone CarmMES based on the process knowledge and programming ability. I think we can increase the efficiency of job performance by learning the logic and application method of solution. In addition, we will find suppliers, analyze how they are actually operated, and improve them to improve their job performance. After that, I will draw my future, which is called the 'key human resource of MES solution construction' at LG CNS. I will become an engineer who can provide competitiveness and flexibility to suppliers in line with the production ecosystem that will change radically.",,,,

When I decided to become a developer, my biggest goal was to see as many people as possible use the programs I contributed conveniently. There are many programs that pass people's hands, but financial services are always a service that exists firmly next to one person, and I wanted to become a digital financier and contribute to the development of the programs that each customer needs to shine on the company and myself. Also, as I have a hobby of trading stocks and cryptocurrencies, as I used many financial transaction programs, I wanted to devote my passion to these big financial programs. During development, the most important thing is 'Can users use all services conveniently while using the programs without difficulty?' The purpose of the program is to provide comfortable and accessible services to users, so we should try to make it comfortable and accessible. I think the behavior of developing and thinking about how to always put customers first, whether they can receive services more comfortably and whether they can receive trust, is the responsibility I should have as a financial developer. When I used IBK's homepage and application, I was amazed that all the values that were important to me were incorporated. User-oriented functions and design arrangements greatly ignited my passion to work for IBK. Even within the job application page, I dreamed of becoming an IBK person because I thought there was a lot to learn about the existence of trivial but definitely convenient functions such as the number of characters on the right side of the page and a spelling calculator. I was interested in blockchain technology and cryptocurrency "solving problems through quick response." I created an automatic transaction bot using a homepage and a specific exchange API that informs the market price and information of cryptocurrency. There was a meeting where we shared information and talked while investing in cryptocurrency, and I shared that if anyone wanted to use the automatic transaction bot program that I created by myself, I would use it even though I was not good enough. In addition, I made the program by improving the program, receiving opinions such as inconvenience to users and functions that would be good to be added. There is a clear difference between the functions that users think of as developers and the functions that users think of as convenient, and there is always room for improvement, so communication with users is important and we continued the development. While developing, there was a time when the program failed due to changes in the API. If it was a program that I use alone and develop, there was no problem, but it could have been a big problem because it was an important moment for other acquaintances to trade money. However, after learning that the problem had occurred, I quickly identified the problem and canceled the user's linked private API key to block automatic transactions within the program, and solved the problem by modifying the program. It was a situation that could have caused a big problem, but as a result of responding calmly without panicking, I was able to solve the error without any problems. This experience made me feel the importance of quick response with my whole body, and I also learned that I have to take great responsibility in developing as a program distributor. Breaking down barriers between developers and users, communicating comfortably, and improving programs are critical to the development of programs. I am confident that I will fully perform my role as software engineering to design and implement programs, improve errors and convenience through testing, and distribute them to users to advance programs.""The innovation I have experienced is fingerprint recognition. When early smartphones were developed, there were two main methods of locking mobile phones: passwords and patterns. However, this was a lock that was far from strong security because it could be easily unlocked if someone other than the owner knew the password or pattern of the phone. When iris recognition was subsequently performed through the front camera, I felt that security was stronger than before, but there were cases where errors unlocked someone else's iris, and above all, it was so far removed from the most important convenience that people did not use it much even though the function existed. I also thought that all of the above-mentioned locking methods were cumbersome and cumbersome that the functionality was so inconvenient that I used a cell phone without using the lock function. But since then, fingerprint recognition has been a huge innovation for me. The method of fingerprinting security was unthinkable, the only security device that identifies itself, and it was very convenient as a system that recognizes with a short touch of a finger. Fingerprint recognition, which continues to be used as a mobile security device and is increasingly utilized, has become indispensable. In the past, when using mobile banking, simple identity authentication using fingerprints from uncomfortable functions that had to include all special symbols, English and numbers, has made financial services one of the convenient functions of life. Innovative functions are not limited to one area, but can be used in many other areas, and I think they should be efficient in terms of convenience and have a powerful effect in terms of security. Seeing that fingerprint recognition, which was one of the unlocking functions of the mobile phone, is now being used in finance as it is now one of the self-authentication functions, I think there is no shortage in being selected as the most innovative function of today." As fast and easy services are pursued, faster and more convenient functions are emerging into the world. I-ONE Bank, which allows you to use financial services with only six-digit passwords instead of public certificates or complex passwords in a financial environment, is also a feature that highlights differentiation and simplification in a rapidly changing financial environment. However, behind the easy and convenient functionality, security issues are looking for opportunities to catch on. Financial customers want quick and easy features, but they are concerned about security issues and worry about using them.The occurrence of problems can happen anytime, anywhere, under any circumstance. I can't guarantee that all problems are blocked at the source, but I think a quick response is always possible. When a problem occurs, first, a quick apology to customers, then calmly identify the cause and solution of the problem, inform customers transparently, and respond quickly to the problem, which can be an opportunity to increase trust in customers. Quick response that turns a crisis into an opportunity can be an opportunity to win favor from customers and enhance the image of the company. In addition to coping with problems within the company, it is necessary to be able to present a quick response to problems caused by customers' mistakes. Everything is possible with mobile phones, but on the other hand, it has become a world where nothing can be done without mobile phones. The first thing to worry about when you lose your phone is the problem of financial services. Although it is the occurrence of a problem due to the customer's own mistake, a quick response that blocks the source of the concern one step ahead of the company will greatly help the company's growth. At the center of the direction listed above is the customer. We need customer-centered thinking that always puts customers first. If you think from the customer's point of view and always keep in mind what features will make you more comfortable, the company's authenticity will open its heart and become a company that can reach people more comfortably.",,,,

"Theory is weak but practice is strong" In the computer structure lecture, I ranked 32nd out of 40 students in the midterm theory test. It was the result of not studying much because my theory was weak and overlapped with other tests. I usually listened to the lecture hard, but my midterm score was low, so I felt denied for listening to the lecture hard. I thought that the way to prove that I listened to the lecture hard was a practice project, so I set my goal of winning first place in the project. There were a total of 8 teams, so I thought it would not be easy to win first place. The project was to design an electronic calculator using Logic works. Basically, it was a project that was given an electronic calculator capable of only four four-digit arithmetic operations and added with the function in mind. Through meetings with team members, since the logic circuit consists of binary digits, we implemented the octogenarian converter, exponential functions, factoring, permutation, and combination operations. The aforementioned functions were implemented in the same way by other team members, which faced an obstacle of implementing new functions. In order to achieve the target of winning first place, a differentiated function was unconditionally required. Looking at the calculator to implement differentiated functions, I looked through Google how the calculations were performed and found that sin, cos could be implemented. Both sin and cos were implemented by simply calculating the front part using Taylor series to express the approximation. I added sin, cos, and finally, changed the calculation to 5 digits to complete the project. As I was working on the project, I thought I could win first place because I had invested 3 hours a day constantly in the project and created more functions than other teams. As a result of the project presentation and demonstration, our team was the only one who implemented trigonometric functions, and we achieved the result that we implemented the most functions and won first place in the project. From this experience, I learned that if you work hard, you will always get a result. SK C&C will also continue to work hard to prove the results of your work as achievements and contribute to the development of SK C&C through achievements." "Reduced number of return cases through meetings" Working as a OOOOO tester, I served as the contact app domain leader. The common task was to solve OOO-related problems that came in every day, and as a leader, I assigned the task to the team members, synthesized it again, and reported it to the manager. In the process of solving the problem, the individual handled the problem, but even if the problem was corrected, it could not be solved and it was returned. Reprocessing the problem that has been returned resulted in a waste of time because the problem was handled twice, which could be solved at once. In order to prevent waste of time, we suggested to team members that difficult problems be resolved through meetings as a solution to reduce the number of return cases. The reason I haven't used the meeting in the meantime is that I'm concerned that even if a meeting is held, rejection may occur and it can be a waste of time because we spend time solving one problem together. However, I thought it would be wrong to judge the result before trying, so I tried for now. The introduction of the meeting had the effect of reducing the number of return cases, which was the previous goal. Time also resulted in an increase in the total workload of the problem, rather than falling at all, even if the time of the meeting was used, as the time to reprocess the return cases decreased. The manager suggested the same problem-solving method to other domains because of the successful result of reducing companion cases and increasing time efficiency. Conference was introduced in all domains afterwards as a result. SK C&C will also think of a more efficient way to solve the task in the process of solving the task through the experience of having successful results by incorporating new things, and will make an effort to increase the work efficiency by suggesting it to the team members.""Still strengthening Programming Capabilities" It is the basic and core of Solution SW's job. Because it is necessary to understand and process one's work. I made the following efforts to improve my programming capabilities. First, I took lectures focusing on programming. In the case of mandatory majors according to the completion system of the information and communication engineering department, the proportion of telecommunication and network lectures is higher than that of programming lectures. As a result, I thought that the required programming lectures were not enough, so I took the elective major mainly on programming lectures. By taking lectures on object-oriented language, practice, data structure, computer algorithm, and practice, I learned languages such as C++ and JAVA, learned algorithms and data structure, and built up programming skills. Second, I studied algorithms. I thought I needed to study algorithms because I thought algorithms were the core of programming. I studied algorithm theory first and then learned the basics by doing basic implementation. After that, I solved algorithm problems through online algorithm problem solving sites, reviewed my motives, and each code, and developed application skills. In addition to solving problems, I also studied algorithmic capabilities by completing 40 hours of special lectures on algorithms at Samsung SDS. Third, I worked on several projects. When I worked on projects such as "Healthcare Application using Smart Watch" and "Smart Door Lock using BLE Beacons," I realized the right functions of each project. The projects received A+ and B+ grades, respectively. Through the results of the project, I was able to confirm my capabilities and realized that I should work harder. I think there is no end to the study of the developer. I think the moment I am complacent at my level, I am eliminated. In order not to be eliminated, I will constantly strive to strengthen my capabilities. I will do my best to become a company that will not be stopped even after joining SK C&C, but will always continue to be a talented person who will not be eliminated. In conjunction with OOOOO Systems, we have undertaken a graduation project under the theme of "Smart Door Lock Using BLE Beacons."It was too much to do everything alone by using the application, Arduino, server, and DB in the project, so I found a team, and four people including myself formed a team so that they could take on one part each. It was a short project that lasted for two months after the team was set up, and through a meeting with a company mentor, I set my goal to complete the unlocking function of the door lock according to the security level first. I was in charge of the application. First, I used Beacon for the first time, looked it up on Google, and studied it by asking a motive who used it before. After studying, I started implementing the function. After implementing a simple login system, I implemented a function that measures the distance from the target function, beacon, determines user information, and sends an unlocking signal to Arduino. In the process of checking whether the function is working normally with the Arduino team member, if the distance was set short, the problem of reaching the door before the door opened occurred. We continuously tested it so that it could be properly opened in time for the user to reach the door, and found and set the optimal distance of 3m. We successfully achieved the previously targeted results by integrating the implementation parts into one and creating a prototype with a storage cabinet by implementing each of the team members responsibly. In the process of writing patent drafts for submission after the project, there was a disagreement over whether to write the subject as a smart door lock or a small-scale bicycle smart lock. To select a topic, I consulted a mentor and was recommended a bicycle lock that was not registered in the existing patent, so I wrote the patent drafts as a bicycle lock. Based on the experience of collaborating with others on tasks that are difficult to do alone and trying to achieve common goals, SK C&C will also try to achieve the goal as an individual or a team member.",,,,

"Life with Games" When I was in the lower grades of elementary school, I liked to play outside with my friends, and I was far from computer games or studying. Then, in the fourth grade, I came across Maple Story, which started its service in 2003. Easy and simple horizontal scrolling and cute graphics caught my attention, and I was able to experience characters from warriors, archers, wizards, bandits, and all occupations. Another game that was popular among classmates at the time was Crazy Arcade, where I played games for a long time, admiring the novel ideas of suppressing opponents with water balloons and the easy difficulty that anyone could play. Since then, I have expanded my feet by encountering Kart Rider and other games such as Trickster, Vegetable Club, and Grand Chase. In the sixth grade of elementary school, instead of running with friends on the playground after school, I even went to a PC room for the first time to play games together. I remember being amazed by playing games on computers with good specifications unlike at home. While entering middle school, I became interested in studying and always maintained a top grade. In the meantime, however, I enjoyed playing rhythm games such as O2Jam and DJ Max when I was not studying. I felt pleasure whenever I achieved a higher score than my opponent by choosing a song that was difficult to clear and competing with other players. When I entered a special purpose high school, I gave up all my hobbies because I was so into college entrance exams, and I focused only on studying in order to make choices that I would not regret in the future. After completing my long four-year entrance exam, after going to the university I wanted, I found the game again as a resting place when I was tired of difficult majors. In 2016, a game called Blizzard Overwatch was released, and when I went to a PC room with my friend's recommendation and played it together, I became interested in FPS after a long time since Sudden Attack I played in my childhood. Since then, I have enjoyed Nexon and Nadic Games' Closer for a while, and also played League of Legends, which had been the No. 1 PC room share for several years. In 2018, I returned to Maple Story, which ended the story of a black wizard with "Teraboning." During my five-year college life, whenever I was exhausted by midterm and final exams, I visited the PC room in front of the school to soothe myself. In retrospect, my life has always been with gaming." "My most passionate games for nearly two years were the online games "Overwatch" and "Maple Story." In 2016, as a junior, I had been depressed a lot after being hit with tough majors in engineering, and one of my best friends recommended me to play Overwatch. I was fascinated by the new genre of FPS, in which the team's strategic play is important, and I was fascinated by characters with a completely different style of play, although they have jobs like offense, defense, tanker, and healer. Overwatch was initially only a battle between players and competition for skill, but over time, it added different modes of play, and I think the most impressive piece of content that has been added is the melee that continues the overall story of Overwatch. I think the fact that there are no limits to the highest level of that game is another thing that sets me apart from other games. My level is now 414, and I have about 224 hours of play. Nexon's flagship MMORPG game, Maple Story, returned to action after watching the premiere of "The Black," which released the final content of "The Wizard" in June 2018, which may seem like a short period of time, but the playing time is by far the best. Except for the exam period, I ran to the PC room and enjoyed Maple Story after finishing my studies. Back then, Maple Story released "Terabening," a new content that improves the level by 3 to 200, and it didn't seem difficult to come back. Its highest level is now 275, and its highest level character has now achieved 211. Not long ago, Terabening returned for the vacation season, creating another professional character with level 200." Among the games I have played in the last five years, online games include Maple Story 2, Elsod, Closer, League of Legends, Overwatch, and mobile games include Kakao Friends games, Kakao-Grand Chase, and Fate Grand Order. Among them, I will tell you about Cypherds and League of Legends. The two games have something in common called AOS, and the strategy of purchasing the right items, raising skill levels in real time, and taking down the opponent's team felt pretty difficult to me. The most interesting games were Overwatch, MapleStory, and MapleStory 2. For me, who didn't usually enjoy playing FPS that kills opponents with weapons in the first person's perspective, the importance of "strategic team play" such as taking up a foothold or pushing cargo seems to have come to me fresh. MapleStory, which was not an exaggeration to say that we grew up together since childhood, continued to introduce new content for about 15 years without stopping, and as a result, it had the charm of keeping the old feeling of longing. MapleStory 2 is the 3D version of MapleStory, so it was not difficult to adapt to the game because its essential content was similar, and I felt anew that I could customize my characters by creating my own 3D modeling. The least interesting game was the Closer. Obviously, the Closer's world view was fresh and the characters were attractive. The game itself wasn't boring, but a lot of bugs that couldn't be fixed and a leak of RAM halved the fun while playing. In addition, the consistent company's refusal to collect customer feedback seems to have made me increasingly tired and less interested as a user."'Perfectionism for others' and 'playing games faster than anyone else' Since I was a child, I have been interested in games, and I have often looked for game-related tasks. Front-end development, back-end development, game planning, game art, game service, etc. There were numerous occupations at a glance. Among them, QA is especially the final process of making games, and hearing that careful work is required to reduce the inconvenience of game users due to bugs, I thought that it would be a good job for me, who felt uncomfortable if I didn't finish anything perfectly. Not only that, but it also felt attractive to be able to enjoy new contents of the game before other users. Entering college and entering my second year, I transferred to the Department of Convergence Engineering (now a software major) as a digital imaging major. Then, in my senior year, I took a major class called Network Game Programming. Understanding the concept of TCP/IP, building my own client and server to enable communication, and making games using it was the final task of the Network Game Programming course. Building the server wasn't easy for me, and I had to deal with a lot of bugs from the start. However, the process didn't feel painful. I would be absolutely delighted if I could make my own game perfect and someone else could enjoy it. With that mindset, I successfully created a small game that can compete one-on-one with users connected to the same server in real time after debugging countless times. And throughout my five years of college, I have consistently engaged in IT-related external activities. Throughout my career, I worked as OOO ICT mentoring supporters, Jotaek computer supporters, and supportive supporters of the game industry, I developed knowledge of the game industry and computer utilization skills, and communicated with my colleagues with respect for each activity. I think that my experience and my accumulated major knowledge will be helpful in communicating with developers to fix big and small bugs in the game. "QA to challenge, QA to communicate." If I join Nexon Networks and become a game QA, I will go beyond simply fixing the bug and suggest ways to improve the game. When I play the game from my user's point of view, I suddenly think, "If this place is improved like this, users will be able to play the game more comfortably!" Rather than arbitrarily deciding on these opinions, I will communicate with other users through SNS and lead the game improvement in the best direction. So my goal is to create a "God Game" that satisfies both the game producer and the user who plays the game. "As always, as the first time." Even three years after I join the company, I want to be recognized as the same person as the first time. I don't want to become a QA that handles things roughly as the trick increases even if I get used to my work. I will always keep my original intentions and keep poring over the game to see if there is anything wrong and if there is anything to improve. For the user, the same game will be a QA that plays dozens and hundreds of times with joy.",,,,

A challenge is to take risks, set goals, self-improve and take initiative in order to achieve them. I have built my own career by 'challenging' a new field for my dream. When I was in my second year of college, I was very interested in big data analysis that looked into the future by reading a book called Signal and Noise. I thought that the core basis of big data analysis was to build a platform for storing and processing vast amounts of data, so I dreamed of becoming a big data developer. To this end, I took the risk of starting a new field called IT and challenged the Java & Big Data Developer Training Course. First, I set my goal to be proficient in Java. Although I had difficulties with APIs and algorithms I encountered for the first time, I implemented programs such as mine search and multi-chatting after trying to know for sure through code refactoring. Furthermore, by completing the 'Academy Management Program' and the 'Social Baseball Organization Website' MVC2 project, I was able to acquire the ability to develop Java and various web development languages, Oracle DB, and spring framework. Through the successful completion of the course, I was able to learn the value of the challenge by acquiring my own know-how to acquire new fields as well as the basic skills of development. I will become a Hanwha person who constantly challenges and does not settle for the existing framework and develops day by day. Through the academy management project, I learned that 'collaboration' is to help each other's difficulties and move in a better direction. As I proceeded with the project, there was a difficulty in overall development progress due to the unbalanced division of work. The server I was in charge of had a high proportion of work because data transmission and reception had to be done with all clients. We publicized this problem situation and talked together, and found that the team members also had a burden of work. Based on related functions and logic, it was suggested to reorganize the division of work to cooperate more than before. With the help of the team members, I was able to build the server easily, and I also won first place in the process by analyzing the code created by the team members and demonstrating cooperation to help them complete their functions. Through teamwork by sharing not only each other's difficulties but also knowledge and experience, I was able to realize efficient work. Based on this, I will become a Hanwha person who can approach the difficulties of my colleagues first. In order to provide practical help, I will grasp the overall work process and secure expertise in the field I am in charge of. I once caused damage to my team members by giving up specialized training in Data Science. At that time, I did not have enough time to participate in the training while working on the MVC2 project, so I did not have enough time to fulfill my role. I studied R with the help of my team members to analyze the csv file I was in charge of, but I was eventually forced to quit the training due to the deadline for the project. I learned desperately that excessive motivation can cause great damage to the organization. Since then, I have made an effort not to reverse my failure by organizing schedules on a weekly basis, allocating priorities, and finishing important tasks in turn. Through this, I will become a member of Hanwha S&C who can completely perform my tasks and devote myself to the organization." First, I am constantly interested in and execution of new technologies. Through this, I have developed my capability to build a data distributed processing platform related to Hanwha S&C's HONE-G platform.
